column4: What's a good IRC client that will show up in the programs list? Konversation requires me to run it as root, and it seems that's why I'm banned from some channels.
konversation does not require you to run it as root...
Whenever I don't run it as root I get a lot of errors and it doesn't open.
pastebin the errors you get
http://pastebin.com/m1ad3f84f
it's exactly because you run things as root that you are having this issue. You have files in your HOME owned as root now
do: sudo chown $USER: ~
do: sudo chown -R $USER: ~
Done, but I still get those errors.
did you run my second command?  As my first one was wrong
Okay, that outputs: "chown: cannot access `/home/damien/.gvfs': Permission denied"
paste the command you ran here
sudo chown -R $USER: ~
what does 'ls -ld /home/damien/.kde{,share}' return now?
what does 'ls -ld /home/damien/.kde{,/share}' return now?
and the second command?  use pastebin
http://pastebin.com/m2125f710
I don't know why you are getting an error on .gvfs, but I think everything else went okay.  Try running konversation now.  You probably want to log out and log back in anyway though
Alright, I'll do that as soon as I'm done compiling open office.
why compile it?  It's packaged in the repositories
